HBcAg at various concentrations (0.3-10 μM) was incubated at 6° for 18 hr with fusion phage Bl (10<sup>9</sup> pfu/ml) in TBS/BSA (0.2 mg/ml)/NaN<sub>3</sub> (0.02%).
The HBcAg concentration range was 1.58-50 μM for experiments with phage B2 and B3 and was 0.63-20 μM for experiments with phage B4.
For peptide inhibition experiments, fusion phage (10<sup>9</sup> pfu/ml; 200 μl) were incubated with various concentrations of peptide (lmM-10 nM) in HBcAg- coated wells for 90 min at 6°C.
Reactions (18 μl) contained 2 μl of a 1:10 dilution of the transcription reaction, 10 μl of rabbit reticulocyte lysate, 20 μM of amino acid mixture minus methionine, 0.7 μl of [<sup>35</sup>S] methionine
